explanation:
toxdigitvalue: This function is called inside the loop body to compute digit; its behaviour is part of the loop body per the MISRA rule ("The behaviour of a for loop body includes the behaviour of any functions called within that statement"). You must inspect toxdigitvalue to ensure it has no persistent side effects or that it does not modify any objects that would serve as a loop counter or loop-control flag (or other objects used in the loop condition), since such side effects could make the loop ill-formed under the MISRA rule.

UINT32_MAX: Used in the overflow-check expressions in the loop. Confirming that UINT32_MAX is an integer constant (macro from limits.h) and has no side effects is necessary because the rule forbids clause expressions that have persistent side effects or use objects modified in the loop body. If this identifier were a macro or function with side effects (or depended on mutable objects), it could affect whether the loop satisfies the MISRA requirement.
